hints_html: What rules of differentiation will you need here?
hints_latex: What rules of differentiation will you need here?
hints_raw: What rules of differentiation will you need here?
question: 10 (a)
sols_html:
We need to make sure to use both the product rule since we have 2x2 multiplied by sin(1/x) and then use the chain rule to deal with sin(1/x).

We obtain:

\[\begin{aligned} f'(x) &= 1 + 4x \cdot \sin(1/x) + 2x^2 \cdot \cos(1/x) \cdot (-x^{-2}) \\ &= 1 + 4x\sin(1/x) - 2\cos(1/x)\end{aligned}\]
sols_latex:
We need to make sure to use both the product rule since we have
2\emph{x}\textsuperscript{2} multiplied by \emph{sin}(1/\emph{x}) and
then use the chain rule to deal with \emph{sin}(1/\emph{x}).

We obtain:

\begin{align*}
f'(x) &= 1 + 4x \cdot \sin(1/x) + 2x^2 \cdot \cos(1/x) \cdot (-x^{-2}) \\
&= 1 + 4x\sin(1/x) - 2\cos(1/x)
\end{align*}
sols_raw:
We need to make sure to use both the product rule since we have 2''x''<sup>2</sup> multiplied by ''sin''(1/''x'') and then use the chain rule to deal with ''sin''(1/''x'').

We obtain:
:<math>\begin{align}
f'(x) &= 1 + 4x \cdot \sin(1/x) + 2x^2 \cdot \cos(1/x) \cdot (-x^{-2}) \\
&= 1 + 4x\sin(1/x) - 2\cos(1/x)
\end{align}</math>
